titles.ar: باب الْحَائِضِ وَ النُّفَسَاءِ تَقْرَءَانِ الْقُرْآنَ
titles.en: Chapter 19 – The menstruating woman and the one with post-childbirth bleeding (Nafsa’a), reciting the Quran

titles.ar: باب الْحَائِضِ تَأْخُذُ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ وَ لَا تَضَعُ فِيهِ شَيْئاً
titles.en: Chapter 20 – The Menstruating woman can take something from the Masjid and she cannot place anything in it

titles.ar: باب الْحَائِضِ تَقْضِي الصَّوْمَ وَ لَا تَقْضِي الصَّلَاةَ
titles.en: Chapter 18 – The menstruating woman would make up the (missed) Fasts and she would not make up the (missed) Salaats

titles.ar: باب الْحَائِضِ وَ النُّفَسَاءِ تَقْرَءَانِ الْقُرْآنَ
titles.en: Chapter 19 – The menstruating woman and the one with post-childbirth bleeding (Nafsa’a), reciting the Quran

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/250)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ وَ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: الْحَائِضُ تَقْرَأُ الْقُرْآنَ وَ تَحْمَدُ اللَّهَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, and Hammad, from Muawiya Bin Ammar,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The menstruating woman can recite the Quran and Praise Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from ibn abu ‘Umayr and Hammad from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Women while experiencing Hayd (menses) have permission to recite al-Quran and praise Allah.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/251)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ زَيْدٍ الشَّحَّامِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: تَقْرَأُ الْحَائِضُ الْقُرْآنَ وَ النُّفَسَاءُ وَ الْجُنُبُ أَيْضاً .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umer, from Zayd Al Shahham,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘The menstruating woman can recite the Quran, and the one with the post-childbirth bleeding (Nafsa’a), and the one with sexual impurity’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Zayd al-Shahham who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Women experiencing Hayd (menses), childbirth and one involved in sexual activities (because of which Ghusl (bath) is obligatory) can read al-Quran.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/251)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الطَّامِثِ تَسْمَعُ السَّجْدَةَ قَالَ إِنْ كَانَتْ مِنَ الْعَزَائِمِ فَلْتَسْجُدْ إِذَا سَمِعَتْهَا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Mahboub, from Ali Bin Raib, from Abu Ubeyda who said,

‘I asked Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> about the menstruating woman hearing the (Verse of) the Prostration (in the Quran). He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If it was from the determined ones, so let her prostrate when she hears it’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hassan ibn Mahbub from ibn Ri’ab from abu ‘Ubaydah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a woman who experiences Hayd (menses) whether she can listen to recitation of the verses of al-Quran that requires prostration. He (the Imam) said, ‘If it is of al-‘Aza’im kind, she must prostrate when she listens to it.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/251)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ التَّعْوِيذِ يُعَلَّقُ عَلَى الْحَائِضِ فَقَالَ نَعَمْ إِذَا كَانَ فِي جِلْدٍ أَوْ فِضَّةٍ أَوْ قَصَبَةِ حَدِيدٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Mansour Bin Hazim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the amulet hanging upon the menstruating woman. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, when it was (enveloped) inside a skin, or silver, or an iron tube’.
en.sarwar: 4. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from Safwan ibn Yahya from Mansur ibn Hazim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of al-Ta‘widh (protective talisman) which women hang on themselves. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, they can do so if it is incased with leather, silver, tube or iron.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن وآخره مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/251)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ فَرْقَدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ التَّعْوِيذِ يُعَلَّقُ عَلَى الْحَائِضِ قَالَ نَعَمْ لَا بَأْسَ
قَالَ وَ قَالَ تَقْرَؤُهُ وَ تَكْتُبُهُ وَ لَا تُصِيبُهُ يَدُهَا وَ رُوِيَ أَنَّهَا لَا تَكْتُبُ الْقُرْآنَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Dawood Bin Farqad,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the amulet hanging upon the menstruating woman. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, there is no problem’.
He (the narrator) said, ‘And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She can recite it and write it, but her hand cannot touch it’. And it is reported that she cannot write the Quran.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Dawud ibn Farqad who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of al-Ta‘widh (protective sacred expressions from Quran or names of Allah) which women hang on themselves. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, it is not harmful.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘She can read, write but must not touch.’ It is narrated that she cannot write al-Quran.’”
